alert.note: Alert for Mineral (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Air Quality Alert issued September 09 at 9:10AM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...AIR QUALITY HEALTH ADVISORY FOR WILDFIRE SMOKE FROM 900 AM SATURDAY UNTIL 900 AM SUNDAY... The Colorado Department of Public Health and Environment has issued the following... WHAT...Air Quality Health Advisory for Wildfire Smoke. WHERE...Eastern Archuleta and southern Mineral and Hinsdale Counties. WHEN...900 AM Saturday September 09 to 900 AM Sunday September 10 IMPACTS...The Bear Creek and Quartz Ridge wildfires are producing moderate to heavy smoke Saturday morning for eastern parts of Archuleta and southern portions of Mineral and Hinsdale Counties. This smoke will decrease by late Saturday morning as atmospheric mixing increases. By Saturday night, moderate to heavy smoke from the Bear Creek fire will accumulate along Weminuche Creek in southern Hinsdale County to the west of Williams Creek campground. Additionally, the Quartz Ridge wildfire in eastern Archuleta County could produce moderate to heavy smoke Saturday night through Sunday morning for locations along East Fork Road westward to Highway 160 north of Pagosa Springs. HEALTH INFORMATION...Public Health Recommendations: If smoke is thick or becomes thick in your neighborhood you may want to remain indoors. This is especially true for those with heart disease, respiratory illnesses, the very young, and the elderly. Consider limiting outdoor activity when moderate to heavy smoke is present. Consider relocating temporarily if smoke is present indoors and is making you ill. If visibility is less than 5 miles in smoke in your neighborhood, smoke has reached levels that are unhealthy.
